info.name: Paranasal air sinus: Ethmoidal
info.description: The ethmoidal air sinuses (or cells) are small invaginations of the mucous membrane of the middle and superior nasal meatus into the ethmoid bone between the nasal cavity and orbit.  Usually not visible on plain radiographs before age 2 but detectable on CT scans.  The anterior and middle ethmoidal cells drain into the middle nasal meatus while the posterior ethmoidal cells drain into the superiror meatus.
